alert.note: Alert for Meade; Shelby (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 8:00AM EST until February 16 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of EAST CENTRAL Kentucky and NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in EAST CENTRAL Kentucky, Anderson. In NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Bullitt, Hardin, Larue, Meade, Nelson, Shelby, Spencer and Washington. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Bardstown, Shepherdsville, Taylorsville, Radcliff, Mount Washington, Hillview, Vine Grove, Lebanon Junction and Hebron Estates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
